titles.title: Organic Carbon, in situ Temperature, Age Data, and Age Models in Scientific Ocean Drilling Holes (Deep Sea Drilling Project, Ocean Drilling Program, and Integrated Ocean Drilling Program)

rightsList.rights: Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-Share Alike 3.0 United States [CC BY-NC-SA 3.0]

descriptions.description: Measurements of particulate organic carbon (POC), in situ sediment temperature, age data, and age models in scientific ocean drilling holes (Deep Sea Drilling Project, Ocean Drilling Program, and Integrated Ocean Drilling Program). The data are from drill holes in global areas of high POC deposition (continental margins and upwelling areas). The variation in POC content with temperature and age in the sediment column is used to study the process of organic matter decomposition.
sediment geochemistry, organic carbon decomposition, in situ temperature, sediment age, age models
